pullRequests.title: Addition of Garage Door Controller and combined Fan on/off, fan speed, Light on/off drivers.
pullRequests.body:
Sorry Johan I could not make it splitting in to PR somehow. I am not totally friends with git yet.
Good that chatgpt is around, otherwise it would have taken some time I think:-).

These 2 drivers are orthogonal except for that the garage door controller has a new Tuya datapoint and the fan/light switch has a new flow card to be able to set the fan speed, but also to be able to display the speed set on the device tile.
The garage door controller I model as a lock to be able to display in the device tile if the door is open or closed.

The 2 new tuya devices I have added support for are:

fan_light_switch_tuya: TS0601_TZE204_lawxy9e2
garage_door_controller: TS0601 _TZE204_nklqjk62

pullRequests.title: Update 1_button_2 driver
pullRequests.body:
Button action was not identified correctly.
LongPress added as button action.
Changed icon and pictures.
++++++++++++++
The identification of the button action did not work.
The best result was achieved by identifying the number 253 in the frame.data. The next number in the frame.data reflects the button action (see also smart_remote_1_button, with the difference that the position in the frame.data has shifted from [1] to [3]).
This version is tested extensively.
Unfortunately I could not get the battery measurement reporting to work. Probably because this is a "sleeping" device.

I did not change the coding regarding the handling of cluster-id 8. Although I suspect that the dimming capabilities are only working if a touchlink connection is established.

See also Issues #1011 and #1026 .

pullRequests.title: Bugfix: Fix TZ3000_abrsvsou dimmer
pullRequests.body:
The dimmer value has two bugs:
1) Homey flows works much better with a 0-1 base, and according to the docs it should not be minus. Thus you can detect plus/minus depending on the direction turned.
2) The dim reported from the device is 250 per half-turn (as in 500 per one rotation). So the value should be divided by 500.
NOTE: The device is speed-sensitive. A full rotation is max 500 when turning it very fast and minimum 25 if going slow... 100 is the "normal speed"

pullRequests.title: Support for smoke detector _TZ3210_up3pngle / TS0205
pullRequests.body:
Adds support for the _TZ3210_up3pngle / TS0205 smoke detector.

The device uses the IASZone cluster for smoke, tamper and battery alarms.
For the battery level status it uses the PowerConfiguration cluster.
Therefore, the proposed device driver uses these two clusters to update the Homey device functions.

There are several issues that relate to or require the implementation of this device:
#483 
#543 
#736 
#776

pullRequests.title: Make motion sensor (TUYATEC-bd5faf9p / Nedis ZBSM10WT) work
pullRequests.body:
Not sure if they've released different versions under the same manufacturer name, but the existing driver didn't work.

With this:

- Don't attempt to configure reporting (unsupported general command)
- Remove the alarm_tamper capability (not seen anything about this being supported and only see the alarm being reported)
- Implement the onZoneStatusChangeNotification
- Keep the measure_battery capability and implement it by periodical polling
- Remove the alarm_battery capability as per the best practices which says never to implement both this and measure_battery

Caveat emptor: I'm new to both Homey and Zigbee so perhaps I'm missing something very obvious or have otherwise done things wrong or in a less than optimal way, but with this the sensor (motion, battery) works. 

As an aside the sensor itself seem very shaky and prone to always report motion in some scenarios (two consecutive status updates with one no-motion followed directly by a motion one). Not sure what is going on there, but seems to be rather common complaint just looking at some reviews.

pullRequests.title: Added Support for (some) Tuya Thermostat Radiator Valve (TS0601) variants
pullRequests.body:
Added support for [MOES / Tuya ZigBee 3.0 Thermostat](https://moeshouse.com/products/smart-programmable-radiator-valve-tv01)

### implemented features

#### capabilities

  - set temerature (target_temperature)
  - set heating mode (auto/manual/holiday) (temeprature_preset)
  - alert battery (alarm_battery)

#### flow cards

  -  **WHEN** target temperature changed
  - **WHEN** battery alarm started
  - **WHEN** battery alarm stopped
  - **AND**  battery alarm is on|off
  - **AND** window is (not) open
  - **THEN** set target temperature to \<number>
  - **THEN** set window open state to \<yes|no>

#### device settings

  - comfort temperature
  - eco temperature
  - holiday temperature
  - window open temperature
  - configure heatplan of device (auto mode)

### open / not implemented features / ideas

#### capabilities

- child lock
- heat stop
- frost protection
- boost
- actual_temperature (requires additional cluster / cluster binding)

#### device settings

- local_temperature_calibration (offset)
- holiday start/stop (maybe capability?)
- synchronize time with coordinator (needs currently to be manually set manually at device | requires ClusterBinding ???)

#### flow cards

- **WHEN** thermostat_preset changed to <preset>
- **WHEN** window open status changed
- **WHEN** window open status changed to \<yes|no>
- **AND**    thermostat preset is <auto|manual|holiday>
- ... ???

#### others

- device setting may create a [tokens](https://apps.developer.homey.app/the-basics/flow/tokens) for e.g. actual temperature, setting temperatures, mode/preset that can be used in other flow cards

### hints and links

- [Zigbee2mqtt Tuya specific cluster / dataPoints](https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee-herdsman-converters/blob/v15.116.0/src/devices/tuya.ts#L2802-L2831)
- [Zigbee2mqtt device description](https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/TV02-Zigbee.html)

### related issues

- closes #140 
- closes #188 

reviewer @JohanBendz

pullRequests.title: Add Neo Siren alarm driver
pullRequests.body:
Dear @JohanBendz,

After having waited some time, I decided to try by myself and I get something which works well for #52 ! I have to learn node.js and homey programming so sorry if everything is not properly done.

My work wand highly inspired from those 2 thinks:
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kkossev/Hubitat/main/Drivers/Tuya%20Smart%20Siren%20Zigbee/Tuya%20Smart%20Siren%20Zigbee.groovy
- https://github.com/mruiter/com.neo/tree/V3/drivers/NAS-AB01ZE

Also by the ay, I don't know if you know this... really interesting: https://github.com/zigpy/zha-device-handlers/tree/dev/zhaquirks/tuya 

I think that it should work for NEO and regular Tuya siren but it will required some logic that I did not yet introduced to decide which command to send. Also I did not yet implemented the temperature and humidity alarm as this is not really needed by me.

I don't know if the behavior that I gave to the driver is the correct one because I decided to update the configuration if some  action card are used (i.e: I update the siren melody using action card, this keeps the config aligned). I don't know how to do it differently as **I don't know yet how to request for attribut reporting when I need it**.

Best,
Jerome

P.S: I really would like to have battery reporting on one of your other app for SONOFF devices and I would be really happy to do it but it seems close source... any way to help also here ?

pullRequests.title: Could you add the support of Tuya 2gang dimmer and 2 switch without N?
Add support for Tuya curtain motors
pullRequests.body:
Hey @JohanBendz, thanks for the well written app üí™üèº.

I have added support for the [Tuya curtain motors](https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005002551866480.html). I got the icon from the [homey-vectors](https://github.com/athombv/homey-vectors-public/blob/master/com.xiaomi-mi-zigbee/drivers/curtain/assets/icon.svg) repo as this motor looks identical to the aqara motor. I got the list of manufacturer names from the [Zigbee2MQTT](https://github.com/M10TrungPhan/Zigbee2MQTT/blob/1657c0869b24329a9afff4a65bd0ecadc9ad69c1/zigbee2mqtt-master/zigbee-herdsman-converters/devices/tuya.js#L472-L483) repo.

You might be wondering why I didn't use the attributes in TuyaSpecificCluster. These are only set when the received command is global and not [cluster specific](https://github.com/athombv/node-zigbee-clusters/blob/master/lib/Cluster.js#L694-L700). Took me some time to figure this out but managed to get it working üòÉ 

I also created an abstract Tuya specific device as I reused some methods from christmas_lights and wanted to avoid code duplication.

issues.title: Feature Request - Mired /white level adjustment
issues.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem or is it a nice addition? Please describe.**
Some devices do have wrong white values. e.g. the mood light from lidl can be much more warm white when paired directly to homey then through the app. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**

A Advanced setting where you can adjust the mireds, Prefilled with the current value read from the device itself

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

The alternative is to pair the devices as a basic zigbee device but that is a hassle with constanly disabling the Tuya zigbee app

**Additional context**

Feel free to connect to investigate this further

Bug report - pls add missing writeInteger in TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js
issues.body:
### Describe the bug

I am using Smart water timer and it stopped working and I got error when I wanted to control this device few months ago, but I did not have time to investigate. I have identified issue now, It seems that someone wrongly deleted in library _TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js_  definition of "writeInteger" datapoint and value. Could you just please restore "async writeInteger" ? 

### To Reproduce

Steps to identify error:

1. Go to TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js  (https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/lib )
2. Search for writeInteger and please restore part which was wrongly deleted.
3. Why writeInteger? Because in device.js in https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/drivers/smart_water_timer is using it and I am getting an error when I want to control Smart Water Timer.
4. then pls reinstall com.tuya.zigbee App
5. If no error could you please update it for everyone?

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running? Homey Pro (Early 2023) 12.5.2
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use? 12.5.2
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using? 0.2.73 Development

fix(repo): R√©solution d√©finitive du conflit par recr√©ation de la branche
issues.body:
### Probl√®me : Le Paradoxe du Workflow (Catch-22)

Le workflow GitHub Actions sur la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` est bloqu√© dans un √©tat de conflit insoluble.

1.  **Le workflow actuel est d√©fectueux** : Il tente une op√©ration `git rebase` qui √©choue syst√©matiquement √† cause de conflits profonds avec le d√©p√¥t `upstream`.
2.  **La correction est bloqu√©e** : Toute tentative de pousser un commit pour corriger le fichier de workflow d√©clenche le workflow d√©fectueux. Celui-ci √©choue avant m√™me que la correction ne puisse √™tre appliqu√©e.

Le workflow se sabote lui-m√™me, emp√™chant toute mise √† jour.

### Solution : Contournement et Recr√©ation Manuelle

Pour briser ce cycle, la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` doit √™tre supprim√©e et recr√©√©e manuellement sur GitHub √† partir d'une source saine. Cette action n'est pas un commit et ne d√©clenchera donc pas le workflow d√©fectueux.

**√âtapes de la r√©solution :**
1.  Une nouvelle branche saine (`jules-final-fix`) a √©t√© cr√©√©e localement.
2.  Cette branche contient le workflow final "auto-r√©parateur", capable de g√©rer les futures synchronisations.
3.  La branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera supprim√©e de GitHub.
4.  Une nouvelle branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera cr√©√©e √† partir de `jules-final-fix`.

Cette proc√©dure garantit que la branche est saine et contient un workflow fonctionnel d√®s sa cr√©ation.

issues.title: fix(workflow): R√©solution finale des conflits de rebase persistants
issues.body:
### ProblÔøΩÔøΩme

Le workflow GitHub Actions √©choue syst√©matiquement √† cause de conflits de `git rebase` avec le d√©p√¥t `upstream`. Les tentatives de correction via des scripts locaux n'ont pas r√©ussi √† mettre √† jour le fichier de workflow sur GitHub, entra√Ænant des √©checs r√©p√©t√©s.

### Solution

Le contenu du fichier `.github/workflows/tuya-zigbee-auto-contributions.yml` a √©t√© remplac√© manuellement par une version corrig√©e et robuste.

#### Changements cl√©s :
- **Suppression du Rebase :** L'√©tape de synchronisation (`Sync with Upstream`) a √©t√© modifi√©e pour ne faire qu'un `git fetch` sans tenter de `rebase` ou de `merge`. C'est l'action principale qui r√©sout le conflit.
- **Utilisation d'un PAT :** Le workflow utilise maintenant un Personal Access token:

, afin d'√©viter les probl√®mes de permissions.
- **Am√©lioration du D√©bogage :** Des commandes `echo` ont √©t√© ajout√©es √† chaque √©tape pour permettre un suivi clair de l'ex√©cution dans les logs.
- **Commit et Push s√©curis√©s :** La logique de commit a √©t√© am√©lior√©e pour ne s'ex√©cuter que si des changements r√©els sont d√©tect√©s.

issues.title: Device Request - Soil meter - HOBEIAN/ ZG-303Z
Device Request - [tuya zigbee smart IR-remote] - [tuya] / [CB3S or ih-f8260]
Device Request - [Zigbee Light Switch Push Button] - [_TZ3000_zxrfobzw] / [TS0002]
Device Request - [Soil Temperature Moisture Plant Sensor] - _TZE200_npj9bug3 / TS0601
Bug report - [Short description]
issues.body:
### Describe the bug

The soil sensor device _TZE284_aao3yzhs shows completely incorrect values for both humidity and temperature (67109121% and 67109120¬∞C respectively), and battery information is not displayed at all. The device appears to be using the Tuya proprietary cluster format but the current driver is trying to interpret the data as standard Zigbee values, resulting in corrupted readings.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Homey App' ‚Üí 'Devices' ‚Üí 'Add Device'
2. Select 'Tuya Zigbee' app
3. Choose 'Soil Sensor' (first option under soil sensors)
4. Pair the _TZE284_aao3yzhs device
5. View the device card in Homey
6. See incorrect values: Luftfuktighet: 67109121%, Temperatur: 67109120¬∞C, Battery: no data

### Expected behavior

The device should display:
- Realistic soil moisture percentage (0-100%)
- Realistic temperature readings in Celsius
- Battery percentage or voltage information
- Proper battery alarm functionality when battery is low

### App and Homey version

- Homey Pro with firmware 7.4.2-0
- Tuya Zigbee App version v0.2.73Test

###

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f9f5b76f-1bca-455a-a33d-be03824ab9c7)

![Soil Sensor showing incorrect values](user-provided-screenshot-showing-67109121-percent-humidity-and-67109120-celsius-temperature)

The screenshot shows the device card displaying:
- Luftfuktighet: 67109121%
- Temperatur: 67109120¬∞C  
- Batteri: (no data shown)
- Batterialarm: (no data shown)

### Additional context

- Device manufacturer/model: _TZE284_aao3yzhs (soil moisture sensor)
- This is a Tuya device that likely uses the proprietary Tuya cluster (0xEF00/61184) for data transmission
- The values 67109120/67109121 (0x04000000/0x04000001 in hex) suggest raw Tuya cluster data being misinterpreted as standard Zigbee values
- Device paired successfully but was automatically assigned to existing "Soil Sensor" driver which doesn't properly handle this specific manufacturer variant
- This is the first Tuya device being tested in this Homey setup
- Diagnostic ID available: d424bf60-018c-4bea-acff-0ff80c363c67
- The device requires specific driver support for _TZE284_aao3yzhs to properly decode Tuya proprietary data format

issues.title: [FIX] R√©soudre le rejet du push (rejected master -> master)
issues.body:
### D√©crire le bug
Lors de l'ex√©cution de `git push`, l'op√©ration est rejet√©e avec le message d'erreur :
`! [rejected]        master -> master (fetch first)`
`error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee.git'`

### Reproduire le bug
1. Avoir des commits locaux sur la branche `master`.
2. Avoir un commit sur la branche `master` distante (sur GitHub) qui n'est pas pr√©sent localement.
3. Ex√©cuter `git push origin master`.

### Comportement attendu
Le push devrait r√©ussir, mais il est bloqu√© par s√©curit√© car les historiques ont diverg√©.

### Contexte additionnel
Ce probl√®me est survenu car le fichier `automation.yml` a √©t√© modifi√© directement sur l'interface web de GitHub, tandis que du code pour des appareils (boutons 3 et 4 gangs) a √©t√© commit√© localement.

La solution consiste √† synchroniser les changements distants avant de pousser, en utilisant `git pull --rebase` pour maintenir un historique propre et lin√©aire.

issues.title: Int√©grer les √©volutions de code pour les boutons 3 et 4 gangs
issues.body:
### Description de la T√¢che
L'utilisateur @dlnraja a d√©velopp√© du code pour la prise en charge de nouveaux appareils :
- Boutons 3 gangs
- Lumi√®re (light) 4 gangs

Ces modifications ont √©t√© faites localement et pouss√©es via plusieurs "push", mais elles ne semblent pas √™tre pr√©sentes sur la branche `master` du d√©p√¥t `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee`.

### Objectif
S'assurer que toutes les modifications de code locales de l'utilisateur sont correctement commit√©es et pouss√©es vers la branche `master` du d√©p√¥t sur GitHub.

### √âtapes √† suivre (pour @dlnraja)
Pour synchroniser votre code local avec le d√©p√¥t GitHub, veuillez ex√©cuter les commandes suivantes dans votre terminal PowerShell sur votre ordinateur :

1.  **Se placer dans le bon dossier :**
    ```powershell
    cd C:\Users\HP\Desktop\com.tuya.zigbee
    ```

2.  **V√©rifier la branche actuelle :**
    ```powershell
    git branch
    ```
    *(Assurez-vous que l'√©toile `*` est bien √† c√¥t√© de `master`)*

3.  **Ajouter tous vos fichiers modifi√©s :**
    ```powershell
    git add .
    ```

4.  **Cr√©er un "commit" qui sauvegarde vos changements :**
    ```powershell
    git commit -m "feat: Add support for 3-gang and 4-gang devices"
    ```
    *(Si vous avez un message d'erreur disant "nothing to commit", passez √† l'√©tape suivante).*

5.  **Pousser vos changements vers GitHub :**
    ```powershell
    git push origin master
    ```

Une fois ces commandes ex√©cut√©es, votre code sera √† jour sur GitHub.

issues.title: [BUG] Le workflow √©choue √† l'√©tape de checkout avec une erreur de token:
issues.body:
### Describe the bug

> Le workflow `Automated Tuya Zigbee Contributions` √©choue syst√©matiquement √† l'√©tape `actions/checkout@v4` avec l'erreur : `Error: Input required and not supplied: token:

, en particulier l'√©tape de `checkout`, car les permissions ont √©t√© configur√©es.

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running?
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use?
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using?

### Screenshots

> L'erreur est visible dans les logs du workflow : `Error: Input required and not supplied: token:
, le `GITHUB_token:

, ce qui n√©cessite une approbation manuelle pour √©lever les privil√®ges.
> 
> **Contexte de la session :**
> - **Utilisateur :** dlnraja
> - **Date de l'erreur :** 2025-07-20 15:54:29 UTC

issues.title: Bug: √âchec de l'automatisation √† cause d'un historique Git conflictuel insoluble
issues.body:
### Describe the bug
L'automatisation des contributions sur le fork `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee` √©choue syst√©matiquement √† cause d'un historique Git conflictuel. Les tentatives de synchronisation, de nettoyage de branche, ou de push forc√© se soldent par des erreurs persistantes, rendant le workflow inop√©rant. Le probl√®me est si profond√©ment ancr√© que seule une r√©initialisation compl√®te du d√©p√¥t (suppression et nouveau fork) a permis de le contourner.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Utiliser le fork initial de `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee`.
2. Tenter de mettre en place un script (PowerShell ou via GitHub Actions) pour synchroniser la branche avec `upstream/master`.
3. Essayer de r√©soudre les conflits ou de forcer un push.
4. Constater les erreurs telles que `! [remote rejected]` ou des √©checs de rebase infinis.

### Expected behavior
Le workflow d'automatisation devrait pouvoir se synchroniser avec le d√©p√¥t `upstream`, appliquer les modifications de code et de documentation, et pousser les commits vers le fork `origin` sans √™tre bloqu√© par des conflits historiques insolubles.

### Screenshots
Les logs des terminaux PowerShell partag√©s dans la conversation illustrent les diff√©rentes erreurs rencontr√©es.

### Additional context
Le probl√®me a √©t√© r√©solu en supprimant compl√®tement le fork `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee` et en en cr√©ant un nouveau, vierge de tout historique conflictuel. La nouvelle configuration, bas√©e sur ce d√©p√¥t propre, est maintenant fonctionnelle. Cette issue documente le "bug" initial pour m√©moire.
